mil5.5.4:0.1_0: The Simile of the Making Hand
mil5.5.4:0.4_0: and pushing the arising of paths.
mil5.5.4:1.1_0: “When the Buddha spoke like this, he said,
mil5.5.4:1.2_0: ‘A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha gives rise to the unarisen path, gives rise to the unarisen path.’
mil5.5.4:1.3_0: And he had spoken to him.
mil5.5.4:1.4_0: ‘Mendicants, I saw an ancient path, an ancient route traveled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past.’
mil5.5.4:1.5_0: If the Realized One became fully extinguished through the wording, he cured the path and ancient path,
mil5.5.4:1.6_0: When the Realized One had spoken,
mil5.5.4:1.7_0: And when I saw what they taught and pointed out by an ancient path, an ancient route traveled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past. So that’s what they haven’t arisen in the past.
mil5.5.4:1.8_0: This is a bowl and robes that should be kept for you.”
mil5.5.4:2.2_0: ‘A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha gives rise to the unarisen path, gives rise to the unarisen path.’
mil5.5.4:2.3_0: And they had lied to him.
mil5.5.4:2.4_0: And when I saw that the Realized One, I went forth, the ancient path, an ancient route traveled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past, future, and presented them.
mil5.5.4:2.5_0: ‘Mendicants, I saw an ancient path, an ancient route traveled by fully awakened Buddhas in the past.’
mil5.5.4:3.1_0: Now, great king, after deceivers, the disappearance of the past, and the future, internal clarity and confidence, and unified mind, without placing the mind and keeping it connected. And the Realized One applied what he did.
mil5.5.4:3.2_0: ‘A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha gives rise to the unarisen path, gives rise to the unarisen path.’
mil5.5.4:4.1_0: What, great king, the jewel-treasurer disappears, the dyer, the jewel-treasurer, and the counselor as they were right on to the same wheel-turning monarch. Would he have you rightly commanded that jewel?”
mil5.5.4:4.2_0: Because the jewel-treasure was not, the jewel-treasure submitted.”
mil5.5.4:4.3_0: “In the same way, great king, see the Buddhas that were concealed by the Realized One, and when he did not see. And when he taught the path, they went to see him.
mil5.5.4:4.4_0: ‘A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha gives rise to the unarisen path, gives rise to the unarisen path.’
mil5.5.4:5.1_0: But when they have a child, they are called a mother whose mother and father.
mil5.5.4:5.2_0: In the same way, when a Realized One is cured a path they have been concealed for four months, and the Realized One sees them. And he made a borrowed goods, and he says,
mil5.5.4:5.3_0: ‘A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha gives rise to the unarisen path, gives rise to the unarisen path.’
mil5.5.4:6.1_0: When no person sees that any part of them doesn’t see anything at all,
mil5.5.4:6.2_0: In the same way, when a Realized One is cured a path they have been concealed for four months, and the Realized One sees them. And he made a borrowed goods, and he says,
mil5.5.4:6.3_0: ‘A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha gives rise to the unarisen path, gives rise to the unarisen path.’
mil5.5.4:7.1_0: But when no matter is clean, you say: ‘I’ll clean it by carrying a stick;’
mil5.5.4:7.2_0: In the same way, when a Realized One is preparing a path, he has been concealed for four months. He taught the path, and made a throat. And he spoke in line with the teaching, and he said,
mil5.5.4:7.3_0: ‘A Realized One, a perfected one, a fully awakened Buddha gives rise to the unarisen path, gives rise to the unarisen path, and gives rise to the unarisen path.’”
mil5.5.4:7.4_0: “It’s good, Sir, that you should repeat what I have said.”
mil5.5.4:8.1_0: The fourth part of knowledge is finished.
